Fields.DialogueText: Fusō reporting for duty, Kanchou!
Better late than never.
This is the morning meeting, yes?
Fusō, it's 1:00 pm... you slept through it.
Permission to receive a debrief, Kanchou!
Never mind that. We've gotten reports of Morganas trying to intercept an oil tanker that was hoping to slip through the net.
Do we think they're specifically after the oil, or is this just taking advantage of a vulnerable target?

Fields.MenuText: Your guess is as good as mine.
Whatever their plot is, we'll foil it!
I find it's usually best to assume the worst.

Fields.DialogueText: It doesn't matter. I won't let them hurt innocent civilians.
That's right. It's our duty to serve and protect!
Whatever it is, we need to be careful.
We sail in less than two hours. Prepare for battle!
@BATTLE
Fusō, you look... almost relaxed today.
I just got a letter from my sister. She's back in Hashirajima after some kind of emergency duty near the Ryukyu Islands. I think. A lot of it's censored.
Is she back for good reasons or bad?
Good, I think. Just some resupplying, mostly. She misses me. We feel less connected than we used to be.

Fields.MenuText: That's rough.
I'm sure you'll see more of each other after the war, if nothing else.
Maybe she just needs more Morganas shooting at her to keep her as distracted as we are.

Fields.DialogueText: It's not as bad as it could be. I'm just glad I can talk to you about these things.
My worst fear is that one of us won't make it through the war...
Kanchou, don't say that!
Well, for what it's worth, I look forward to meeting your sister one day.
Perhaps we can all join for a meal. I know a mean recipe for a stew that I think you'll enjoy!
For now, let's focus on making it through these next battles.
@BATTLE
Sorry.
Kanchou, why are we heading straight into that storm system?
Orders from the S.O. We've been told to mobilize immediately. It's the most direct route there.
But if the storm hits while we're under, it could mean serious danger for everyone aboard.

Fields.MenuText: I'm well aware of that, but we have to make our way over as soon as possible.
I tried to plot a detour, but we were denied by the S.O.
We'll be fine. I bet it won't even rain.

Fields.DialogueText: Must be pretty important, then. Are you sure there's nothing we can do?
You should have a word with them... sending us through the storm like this! Who do they think they are?
I hope you're right, Kanchou...
I won't argue with you, Fusō. This isn't what I wanted to do either. But an order is an order.
I guess you're right... Wait, do you see that out there?
In the clouds?
Grab the binoculars! There's a ship out there!
It's not just any ship, it's the Morgana. Let's see if we can get to it before the weather hits us both!
@BATTLE
Kanchou, are you all right? You seem a little green in the gills.
It's nothing, Fusō. Just a little... digestive unrest. That was some storm.
I know. The rocking kept me up all night. We were going back and forth, back and forth.
... That was just mean-spirited.
I'm sorry - but I told you not to take us through that storm! We're lucky no one was hit by lightning.

Fields.MenuText: I'm sorry I didn't trust you. I'll have better judgment next time.
Agreed. If anyone were hurt, it'd be my responsibility.
Well, we made it, right? So I think you should be thanking me. My health is the least of our concerns.

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe one day I'll be the Kanchou, eh?
If that's true, I still don't understand why we'd risk it...
I'm not worried, Kanchou. I just want to make sure we're all okay now.
Thank you for checking in on me, Fusō. I do appreciate it.
It's my pleasure. After all, it's what a friend does, right?
I don't suppose you'd--
No, no, I'll be fine. Fighting is what a captain does.
*CREEEEAK*
Even a seasick one.
@BATTLE
There it is! The oil tanker!
What's it doing all the way out here?
Doesn't matter. I smell a trap, but we still have to investigate.
I'll rally the team! We'll go in at once!
*BOOM*
Fall back! The tanker's beyond saving!
The flames...
Fusō!
The flames...

Fields.MenuText: Come on, we have to retreat. It was a trap!
I need you to focus!
Fusō, what's wrong?

Fields.DialogueText: You're right. Nothing could have survived that fire.
Kanchou, I'm not sure I can handle this one.
The flames are huge. I - I can't!
Ahh! Morgana sighted. Pull it together, Fusō! We need to get into action.
@BATTLE
I don't know. It's not like the Morganas to waste anything they can repurpose.
I don't see anyone moving...
Have you ever read Dracula?
Kanchou?
Fusō, I need you listening for the enemy! We were supposed to be caught in that blast, and they're going to be coming in to finish us off!
Fusō, can we talk about the other day?
I'd rather not talk about it yet.
You froze up when we were under attack. You know I have to follow up on that.
It's nothing. Just a minor phobia. Fire kind of freaks me out.

Fields.MenuText: Why fire?
I don't think it's a minor phobia.
We all have fears, Fusō. It's okay.

Fields.DialogueText: I've been afraid my whole life. I can't really remember... it's just been my fear.
... No. It's not minor. But it's not a problem that comes up often. I've never acted like this around gunfire. Just these types of flames.
It doesn't feel like it's okay. I froze up in the middle of battle!
Fusō, will this be a problem between us? I need us to be fully open about it. We can't have this happen anymore.
Understood. I'll do my best.
I'll do my best as your captain to help you through this. I swear it.
Promise?
Promise.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, I was thinking about what you said yesterday. With regards to helping me. We should come up with exercises to try and help me tackle my fears.
Hmm. I like the sound of that. We will start small. But I think I have an idea or two of what we may do.
That's great. I want to do my part.
Our goal is to have you manage these fears, so you can still function in battle or anywhere else.
Yes, Kanchou! I want to become faster and stronger; to acknowledge my fears and move past them. Not just for me, but for my country. For all of us!

Fields.MenuText: Now, that's the attitude I like to hear!
I'm going to help you through this, Fusō.
I need you to be strong for our ship the most.

Fields.DialogueText: It's my core belief, Kanchou, to accomplish these dreams.
Thank you, Kanchou. You're more than just an asset to our ship. You've been a good friend for me as well.
I want to be the best part of this ship that I can be.
We'll start soon. We just need to finish a few short missions first. There's Morganas in these waters...
@BATTLE
Are you ready, Fusō? I'm going to light the match.
Give me a second. Now, do it!
... There.
Hmm... this isn't bothering me at all.

Fields.MenuText: That's odd. Must be only the bigger flames that bother you.
Congratulations! You conquered your fears!
Hold it closer. Does that help, or make it worse?

Fields.DialogueText: I would recommend lighting a bigger fire, but I'm afraid that won't be a good option!
If only it were that simple, Kanchou. I think we'll have to try something else.
No, don't! You'll get smoke all over my nose!
So if this isn't a great option, what is?
When I was younger, I learned a certain type of meditation. We could do that instead. It's an ancient deep breathing ritual.
Whatever helps you through it, I'll give it a try!
Later, though. We don't want the Funayūrei taking our breath away.
@BATTLE
The first step is to think hard and breathe... deeply. Try to clear your mind. Think about nothing. Find what makes you happy.
What do you try to think of?
I think of the mountains and the forests of Japan. I think that's why I write so much poetry about it.
What happens when you think of fire? Can you remember?
I think of... burning. I think of buildings under a sky as red as blood, the moonlight crimson, smoke as black as... as...
Fusō!
Sorry. I think we were getting somewhere, though. Let's take a break. Why don't you try?
Just... breathe... right?
What do you think of?

Fields.MenuText: My home.
My family.
The ocean.

Fields.DialogueText: That's great! I'm sure it's a lovely place.
Of course. Kanchou, you're so kind. You must have had a good family.
Always out for an adventure. That's why you're the kanchou!
I'm going to be thinking about it a lot here in a minute.
I'll try too, Kanchou. It's nice not to be the only one.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
All hands on deck. All hands on deck.
What's going on?
It must be an emergency for everyone to get called out.
Look! Out there! Morganas!
What's that they're holding? Oh no... they have flags. Burning flags. One for each of us. Japan, the U.S., Germany... they're all out there.
Fusō, it's going to be fine. Think of the mountains. Remember your poetry, your sister.
Fusō, are you listening? Fusō!

Fields.MenuText: She's in a daze. I have to snap her back into reality!
We have to fight without her...
Fusō, please wake up...

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou! You're here. I'm paralyzed. I can't do this.
What's going on? Kanchou? We're fighting?
Did someone call my name?
I know it's not ideal, but Fusō, we need to defend ourselves!
R-right. Right!
@BATTLE
Come on, Fusō, it's been a day now. You can't hide in your quarters for the rest of your life.
How can I face the rest of the crew, Kanchou, after failing to jump into battle?

Fields.MenuText: Come now, we just have to remember our exercises. Keep breathing.
We all make mistakes. It's what we do after that matters.
I'll reprimand you once for your errors yesterday, but there's more where that came from if you stay in all day!

Fields.DialogueText: Sure, Kanchou... Now, I try to remember, but whenever I think of those Morganas with the burning flags, I get shivers down my spine.
I'm such an embarrassment! But you're right. I need to try and do better... I'll come out.
Ahh! I'm coming out.
There you are. Now, isn't it much nicer to smell the fresh air?
Honestly, it doesn't smell too great right now.
You're right. It's that oil tanker. And right now my fear is that we're going to see more of the same.
I don't understand. Surely they want the oil for themselves. Just burning it...
They don't have too many tricks that can unsettle a Belle the way this has unsettled you.
... So I won't let it unsettle me anymore. I just need to focus, and keep myself calm.
There we go!
@BATTLE
I read somewhere that when you're upset, you're supposed to have someone as a "sponsor."
Where did you read that? Alcoholics Anonymous?
I don't even know what that is. No, I read it in a support manual for mental health.

Fields.MenuText: I never took you for an avid self-help reader, Fusō.
I was just kidding about the alcoholic jab. Although now that I mention it, you do like to drink an awful lot of sake when upset...
I'd like to read that book when you're done with it. Maybe I'll be able to help.

Fields.DialogueText: I do mostly read poetry, but this book just seemed to speak to me when I was younger.
My drinking habits are none of your business. We should just focus on the mission ahead, no?
I don't have it on the ship, but I'm sure you'll be able to help me.
So tell me, then. How can I help you?
We begin when you meditate with me.
As soon as I can. As far as duties go, it's among the least unpleasant I've got.
Hmm, that's the only reason you're looking to help me?
Well, I guess... we are close, now. So maybe, just maybe, I have some... personal ties.
Aha, that's what I thought!
@BATTLE
Are you ready for meditation?
Let's begin. Oh, and thank you once again, Kanchou, for aiding me.

Fields.MenuText: It's my pleasure, Fusō.
Well, a captain has to do what a captain has to do.
I just want no more problems with Morganas.

Fields.DialogueText: It just means so much to me!
Of course, Kanchou. It's just your "responsibility" to the ship.
They can wait, can't they?
What's the first step?
Breathing... in... and out... and back in... and back out...
Breathe in... and out... You know, I think I kind of like this! It reminds me of Eastern medicine.
Well, I do come from that part of the world, Kanchou.
*ALARM*
*sigh*
@BATTLE
Kanchou, there you are!
Oh! Fusō, is it meditation time already?
Those papers... What were you reading?
Just a little research on the Morganas. It seems they're mobilizing further out.
What do we think their target is?

Fields.MenuText: If there's another underdefended oil tanker out there...
If it's a big enough group, I'd assume a convoy or an underdefended port.
Whatever it is, we'll stop them.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not sure I'll be ready to take them on if the fire is as bad as it used to be...
I hope my sister isn't in danger.
You're an endless ball of confidence, Kanchou! That's why we're a great team.
Look at the time! It's meditation now, isn't it?
Hmm... I guess so. Kanchou, why are you being so shady?
I'm not being shady. Come now, let's go.
We'll have to put it off for now, Kanchou. The Funayūrei aren't in the mood.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, the next step in order to do this is to be in the fire with me.
What... what does that mean?
You must share feelings of fire and pain. In order to conquer my enemy, you must be with my enemy.
So, you're saying we should be side by side as we walk through the flames? Seems highly symbolic.
What do you think of when you think of fire?

Fields.MenuText: Love.
Power.
Pain.

Fields.DialogueText: The love from your heart is an ever-burning flame... Interesting.
Fire is powerful. Power can be controlled, or can be let loose. Hmm...
Yes, fire is pain. Fire needs to be avoided, and then put in a box. It's why we use fire for weapons.
Fusō, are you still with us?
Fire...
We have to stick together - wake up!
I'm sorry, Kanchou. I think I was lost in a trance.
I was nervous for a second.
@BATTLE
Kanchou! I have the files you asked for. The research is completed.
Thank you - just leave it with me.
Huh, what's that?
Just some research. Nothing you need to worry about, Fusō.
Oh, okay, that's fine.
Now if you'll excuse me...
*ALARM*
Just as we thought we had a break, eh?

Fields.MenuText: Looks like my reading will have to wait until later...
Perfect timing. Leave it to the Morganas to avoid a tricky situation!
No time to waste. Everyone to the bridge!

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou, if we're defeated here, there won't be any reading at all!
Tricky situation... is there something you aren't telling me?
Let's go!
@BATTLE
Well, no sense in just glaring at these papers.
Kanchou, are you down here still? It's time for meditation. You said you'd start on time tonight. It isn't like you to be the late one!
I'm finishing up this report I have to give to the S.O. Just one more minute.
A report? At this hour? What is that you are reading?
No, that's something different. Don't worry about it.
Well, if you're done, then we can head upstairs.
Fusō... wait.
Kanchou?
You told me once that you and your sister both remember times from before you woke as a Belle.
@BATTLE
Hai. That's right - games, conversations. It's all very hazy, but it was real to us.
I've been reading reports about how Belles' memories from... before... seem to work. And in some cases it seems like vivid impressions are left from the people who were on the ship, not just...
Kanchou, if Yamashiro and I remember the same things, then... I mean, I know they didn't happen in the real world, exactly, but they're still ours.
No, sorry - I'm not talking about your Yamashiro memories. I'm talking about fire.
Kanchou?
September, 1923. Taishō 12. You helped rescue survivors of the earthquake.
The fires after the quake burned for days. The people you helped to rescue... I don't know what they saw, but....
*ALARM*
We should go, Kanchou.
Agreed. But, first, if you don't think I'm on to something here, we don't ever have to talk about this again. Ever.
But if...
We'll talk later, Kanchou. Okay?
Okay.
Kanchou, is this a good time?
If you're ready.
I really have to be, don't I?

Fields.MenuText: I gave up on worrying about what's strange three seconds after I first talked to a warship and had her talk back.
No. I don't think it's strange at all.
Maybe. So what?

Fields.DialogueText: I see...
Hm.
Hm.
So, you remember.
And you're right. I remember things I actually participated in - I remember the... the refugees. And then I remember things that I wouldn't have been close enough to see.
Fusō, you're not failing anybody.
You are too kind, Kanchou. I don't know...
@BATTLE
The first thing I should say is that I remember my duty then vividly. I think... I've met other Belles who came to help then, and I think we all do. I think it's just something unsaid between us all.
Is that strange?
The fire tornado over the Rikugun Honjo Hifukusho...
It belatedly occurs to me that your name is an archaic name for Japan itself. The whole country. Belles sometimes have memories from their namesakes...
It's okay. Take a breath.
Hai.
You might actually have experienced the quake and the fires in ways I can't even hope to understand.
And you think that's what my problems now are about? Why I'm failing?
*ALARM*
Kanchou, do you have a moment?
Always. When nobody's shooting at us, anyway. What's on your mind?
I... I want to tell you something I've never told anyone but Yamashiro. And she always laughed and told me to forget it.
What?
Sometimes I dream I'm dying. Yamashiro's there too, and she's going to sink as well, but I go down first.

Fields.MenuText: But she hasn't had this dream.
Go on.
Well, that got dark.

Fields.DialogueText: If she has, she's never said.
Hai.
I'm sorry, Kanchou.
*deep breath*
It's like I'm breaking in half, Kanchou. And all my fuel is burning in the water around me, tearing away the night.
@BATTLE
Maybe you're right. About some of that coming from the fires after the earthquake. Maybe I'm bringing what really happened into my nightmare.
That's not uncommon. For those of us who aren't also ships, anyway.

But it's the dream the tanker fire reminds me of, I think. Not Tokyo, not those fires. Sometimes it feels more like destiny than just my imagination. Me burning, my sister hunted like a hurt rabbit...
Okay. Then I want you to listen to me, very closely.
Kanchou?
To hell with destiny. I won't let that happen. You hear me?
I'm your captain, and I will not let that happen.
Kanchou...
Come on. I know an easy way to prove it to you.
So, Fusō, it's that time, you know?
What time is that?
Meditation, of course!
Oh! Okay. Let's begin, I guess.
Now, Fusō, think to yourself. Forget about the war, and just focus on what makes you happy.

Fields.MenuText: I need you to think about your sister.
I need you to think about your poetry.
I need you to think about your work on the ship.

Fields.DialogueText: My sister... I miss her. She's the better one out of the two of us.
I love my poetry. It really is the last bit of what connects me to my home.
I enjoy being on this ship. I enjoy being with you, Kanchou.
Is this helping?
Yes, it's working. I feel better. I have to remember the good things in life.
You're right. We need to work together to become stronger, right?
I think you're exactly right.
@BATTLE
@BATTLE
Kanchou, come quick!
Is something the matter?
The Funayūrei have another oil tanker - or one they've pieced together themselves. They're just parading it around, daring us to come for it.

Fields.MenuText: We go after them, of course.
I'll call the S.O. and ask for a plan of attack.
We wait and see what happens.

Fields.DialogueText: That's what my plan was. I've already briefed the navigator!
No time for that, Kanchou. We either go now or suffer the loss.
We can't wait, not when there are innocent lives at stake!
Fusō, if we face the Morganas, what will you do?
I'm ready, Kanchou. Remember when I said we'd walk through the flames? This is what I'm prepared to face. No more hiding.
What's that the Funayūrei have? There, on the horizon.
We'll deal with it when we get there!
Look off the port side, Kanchou. You see them, don't you?
Let me get the binoculars... Fusō, take a look. They're ready for us.
I can do this, Kanchou. The fire can't harm us.

Fields.MenuText: Now that's the attitude I like to hear!
Fusō, I'm standing right by your side. We can do this!
Get the crew ready. Let's give them a taste of our arsenal.

Fields.DialogueText: Just trying my hardest, Kanchou.
Thank you, Kanchou. I knew I could rely on you!
Aye-aye! I'm ready to protect our ocean!
Here they come... Fusō?
The fire. We're stronger. They may burn our flags, but they can't burn our spirit!
Crew, report to battle stations!
@BATTLE
Fusō, are you down here?
Yes, Kanchou, I was about to begin my mediation.
Oh, you don't want me to help?
No. Ever since that last battle, I'm quite capable of figuring it out on my own.
I'm glad, Fusō. I'm very proud of you for the challenges that you've overcome.
We all work to be a little bit better, right?

Fields.MenuText: I'd like to meditate with you, if that's okay.
Well, if you ever still need me, I'm here.
I'm glad you don't need my help anymore!

Fields.DialogueText: You're always welcome to join me. All you need to do is ask.
I'm very lucky to have you as my Kanchou and my friend.
Of course! But I'll have to make sure you're always all together as well, right?
Well, let's have a nice night then. We have a big day tomorrow.
@BATTLE
There haven't been any more reports of rigged oil tankers, Kanchou. In case you were wondering...
Once they stopped sensing weakness, they stopped being willing to waste resources. I'm not too surprised.
But there's still a long war left to fight...

Fields.MenuText: Now that we've vanquished their threats, we can go back to winning the war!
It's only enough time until they move their focus elsewhere.
But we still have no idea what the endgame is for these vile creatures.

Fields.DialogueText: Indeed. In fact, I think we've just been called by the S.O. to mobilize tomorrow!
And wherever the Funayūrei come, we'll be there to put an end to it. That's our mission.
I feel that every battle we find more and more clues as to where they came from and what their motives are.
Fusō, you've been a great companion. I couldn't have done any of this without you.
Now, the war isn't over. It's important that we eliminate the Funayūrei before anyone else gets hurt. You can thank me then!
@BATTLE
Fusō, look what just came in from the mail - some sake!
Sudō Honke... that's very good. Where did it come from?
It came with this note. Why don't you read it?
"For the Kanchou who helps those friends fight the fire, when the burns and the scars disappear, you will come away stronger and greater."
Yamashiro. She sent that to you? But how did she know?
I don't know, I never told her.
Then... how?

Fields.MenuText: It must be a sisterly bond you two have.
Your sister knows you better than anyone.
Perhaps we will never know.

Fields.DialogueText: She did a good thing, and I'm glad she thanked you.
The only one who knows me that well... is you, Kanchou.
I'll have to ask her when the war is over, Kanchou.
Let's have a glass, Kanchou.
What shall we toast to?
How about a toast to friendship?
KANPAI!
KANPAI!
